AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Name should begin with a letter and use characters (aA-zZ, 0-9, _ ) of length 3 to 30
AttributeReference.description: Enter a name for the XML Digital Signer step. Begin with a letter and use characters (aA-zZ, 0-9, _ ) of length 3 to 30

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Following characters ( '&' (ampersand) '"' (double quote) ''' (apostrophe), '<', '>', '+', '\\' (backslash)) are not allowed for private key alias
AttributeReference.description: Enter an alias for selecting a private key from keystore
Select a signature algorithm for the RSA or DSA private key type. Using the private key, the sender encrypts the digest.

Select the digest algorithm that is used to calculate a digest from the canonicalized XML document. Note that if the digest algorithm is not specified, the digest algorithm of the signature algorithm is used by default.

Select the signature type to sign a specific part or the whole of the XML message. Enveloped signature: The signature is inserted into the content, which is signed. Enveloping signature: The signature itself contains the data to be signed. Detached signatures: The signatures are siblings of the signed elements.
For enveloped signature, enter the parent element name within which the signature is inserted
For enveloped signature, enter the namespace of parent element of the signature
Specify the parent node for including the signature via XPath expression.
Select the XML schema in the XSD folder. If the folder is empty, insert the XML schema file.

Enter the XPath to the attribute of type ID, in order to identify the element to be signed. Example: /nsx:Document/SubDocument/@Id. Namespace prefixes must be defined in Namespace Mapping of the Runtime Configuration.
Select this option to add the X.509 certificate chain of the signer key to the Key Info
Select this option to add the X.509 certificate of the signer key to the Key Info
Select this option to add the issuer distinguished name and the serial number of the signer X.509 certificate to the Key Info
Select this option to add the key value (exponent and modulus) of the signer key to the Key Info
Select this option to include the Key Info into the signing process
Select a method to canonicalize the SignedInfo element of the XML signature
Select a method to transform the input message body before it is signed

Reference Type helps in the processing the referenced data, where Reference represents the object to be signed. For example, if the Reference is an Object, use the Reference Type as "http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#Object"
Enter a namespace prefix for the XML signature elements
If required specify a Signature Id. Otherwise no Signature Id attribute will be generated.
Select encoding from the list
Select this option to exclude the XML declaration header in the outgoing XML message. For example, <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> will be excluded.
Select this option to disallow DTD DOCTYPE declaration in the incoming XML message
Select this option to add the signing time
Select whether you want to add the signing certificate or the certificate chain of the signing key
Select an algorithm to generate a digest value of the signing certificate
Enter the location of the referenced certificate(s)
Enter the roles of the signer that do not have certificates to corroborate this claim. It can be either text or an XML fragment with the root element "ClaimedRole"
Enter the roles with attribute certificates for the signer
Enter a description of the format of the data to be signed
Enter the MIME type of the format of the data to be signed
Enter an identifier indicating the format of the data to be signed (URI or OID)

The qualifier must not be specified if you are using a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) as identifier. If an ASN.1 Object Identifier (OID) is used as identifier then you have to specify whether the OID is encoded as Uniform Resource Name (URN) or as Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
Enter a description of the identifier
Enter references (URIs) pointing to further explanatory documentation of the identifier
Enter the city of the signer
Enter the state or province of the signer
Enter the postal code of the signer
Enter the country of the signer
Enter the commitment of the signer
Enter a description of the commitment
Enter references (URIs) pointing to further explanatory documentation of the commitment
Enter additional information qualifying the commitment. It can be either a text or a XML Fragment with the root element 'CommitmentTypeQualifier'.
Select the namespace of the used XAdES version
Enter a prefix of the XAdES namespace
Select whether you want to add the signature policy properties. Implied: The "SignaturePolicyImplied" element will be added. Explicit ID: The "SigPolicyId" element will be added.
Enter an identifier that uniquely identifies a specific version of the signature policy (URI or OID)

The qualifier must not be specified if you are using a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) as identifier. If an ASN.1 Object Identifier (OID) is used as identifier then you have to specify whether the OID is encoded as Uniform Resource Name (URN) or as Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
Enter a description of the signature policy
Enter references (URIs) pointing to further explanatory documentation of the signature policy version
Select the algorithm with which the digest value of the signature policy was calculated
Enter the base64 encoded digest value of the signature policy document
Enter additional information qualifying the signature policy. It can be either a text or a XML Fragment with the root element 'SigPolicyQualifier'.
